metadata.enhancements: Added new vocabulary and cultural content

quests.title: Meet the Mufaro Family
quests.description: Visit a traditional Shona family compound and learn about extended family relationships.
quests.culturalFocus: Extended family structures, respect relationships, compound life
quests.storyNarrative: You are visiting the Mufaro family compound in rural Zimbabwe. As you enter the homestead, you notice the traditional layout with the main house (imba) at the center, surrounded by smaller houses for extended family members. The grandmother (mbuya) greets you warmly, and you begin to understand the complex web of relationships that make up a Shona family.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Extended family structures, respect relationships, compound life
quests.culturalContext: Shona family structures extend far beyond the nuclear family. Extended families live together in compounds, with clear hierarchies based on age, gender, and relationship. Understanding these relationships is crucial for respectful communication.

vocabulary.cultural: Primary term for mother, used with respect
Primary term for father, shows respect

vocabulary.culturalSignificance: Primary term for mother, used with respect
vocabulary.cultural: Primary term for mother, used with respect

vocabulary.culturalSignificance: Primary term for father, shows respect
vocabulary.cultural: Primary term for father, shows respect

scenes.title: Arriving at the Homestead
scenes.description: You arrive at the Mufaro family compound and are greeted by family members.

scenes.title: Meeting the Family
scenes.description: Family members introduce themselves and explain their relationships.
scenes.setting: Under the big tree in the compound

scenes.title: Sharing Evening Meal
scenes.description: The family gathers for the evening meal and you learn about food customs.
scenes.setting: Around the fire in the compound

interactiveElements.description: Choose appropriate responses in cultural conversations

scenarios.prompt: How do you respectfully greet Mbuya Mufaro?

quests.title: Traditional Wedding Ceremony
quests.description: Participate in a roora ceremony and understand marriage customs.
quests.culturalFocus: Marriage customs, bride price, family negotiations, traditional ceremonies
quests.storyNarrative: You have been invited to witness a traditional Shona wedding ceremony. The groom's family has come to negotiate the roora (bride price) with the bride's family. This is not just a financial transaction but a ritual that formally joins two families and ensures the bride's protection and respect in her new home.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Marriage customs, bride price, family negotiations, traditional ceremonies
quests.culturalContext: Shona family structures extend far beyond the nuclear family. Extended families live together in compounds, with clear hierarchies based on age, gender, and relationship. Understanding these relationships is crucial for respectful communication.

examples.english: The to marry (for woman) is good

quests.title: Village Council Meeting
quests.description: Attend a dare (traditional court) and learn about community decision-making.
quests.culturalFocus: Traditional governance, community decisions, dispute resolution
quests.storyNarrative: The village is gathered under the big tree for a dare (traditional court) meeting. The headman sits in the center, surrounded by village elders. A dispute between neighbors needs to be resolved, and you'll witness how traditional Shona justice emphasizes restoration over punishment.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Traditional governance, community decisions, dispute resolution
quests.culturalContext: Shona family structures extend far beyond the nuclear family. Extended families live together in compounds, with clear hierarchies based on age, gender, and relationship. Understanding these relationships is crucial for respectful communication.

quests.culturalContext: Shona family structures extend far beyond the nuclear family. Extended families live together in compounds, with clear hierarchies based on age, gender, and relationship. Understanding these relationships is crucial for respectful communication.

quests.title: The N'anga's Wisdom
quests.description: Learn from a traditional healer about medicinal plants and healing practices.
quests.culturalFocus: Traditional medicine, healing practices, medicinal plants
quests.storyNarrative: You are visiting a renowned n'anga (traditional healer) who has agreed to share knowledge about medicinal plants. The healer explains that healing in Shona culture involves not just physical remedies but spiritual balance and community support.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Traditional medicine, healing practices, medicinal plants
quests.culturalContext: Traditional Shona practices are deeply rooted in the belief that the physical and spiritual worlds are interconnected. Ceremonies and rituals maintain harmony between the living, the ancestors, and the natural world.

examples.english: The to consult ancestors is good
I want to pour for family
The to pour for family is good
The to pour water is good

scenes.title: Visiting the Healer
scenes.description: You meet the n'anga and learn about traditional healing practices.

scenes.title: Collecting Medicinal Plants
scenes.description: You accompany the healer to collect medicinal plants from the forest.

scenes.title: Preparing Traditional Medicine
scenes.description: Learn how traditional medicines are prepared and administered.

interactiveElements.title: Cultural Dialogue
interactiveElements.description: Choose appropriate responses in cultural conversations

scenarios.situation: Asking about traditional medicine
scenarios.prompt: How do you respectfully ask about healing practices?

options.culturalNote: How do you heal? - direct and respectful
What medicine for me? - not appropriate inquiry

quests.title: Rainmaker's Ceremony
quests.description: Participate in a mukwerere ceremony to call for rain.
quests.culturalFocus: Weather ceremonies, spiritual connection to nature, community ritual
quests.storyNarrative: The rains have not come, and the community is preparing for a mukwerere ceremony to call for rain. You join the procession to the sacred site where the svikiro (spirit medium) will communicate with the ancestors to request their intervention.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Weather ceremonies, spiritual connection to nature, community ritual
quests.culturalContext: Traditional Shona practices are deeply rooted in the belief that the physical and spiritual worlds are interconnected. Ceremonies and rituals maintain harmony between the living, the ancestors, and the natural world.

quests.title: Sacred Songs and Stories
quests.description: Learn traditional and Christian songs in Shona.
quests.culturalFocus: Musical traditions, religious expression, community worship
quests.storyNarrative: You are attending a church service where traditional Shona hymns blend with Christian worship. The songs reflect both indigenous spiritual concepts and Christian teachings, showing how Shona people have adapted their faith traditions.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Musical traditions, religious expression, community worship
quests.culturalContext: Shona spirituality encompasses both traditional beliefs in ancestral spirits and various forms of Christianity. Many Shona people practice a blend of both, seeing no contradiction between honoring ancestors and Christian faith.

quests.title: Mysteries of Great Zimbabwe
quests.description: Explore the ancient ruins of Great Zimbabwe and their significance.
quests.culturalFocus: Ancient civilization, architectural achievements, cultural pride
quests.storyNarrative: You stand before the massive stone walls of Great Zimbabwe, built by your ancestors over 800 years ago. These ruins represent the height of Shona civilization and continue to inspire pride in Zimbabwean identity.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Ancient civilization, architectural achievements, cultural pride
quests.culturalContext: Zimbabwe's historical heritage includes the Great Zimbabwe ruins, which represent the pinnacle of indigenous African civilization. This heritage is a source of pride and cultural identity for all Zimbabweans.

quests.title: Songs of the Chimurenga
quests.description: Learn freedom songs and understand the liberation struggle.
quests.culturalFocus: Liberation history, resistance culture, freedom songs
quests.storyNarrative: You are learning the freedom songs that sustained the liberation struggle. These songs expressed the hopes and determination of the Zimbabwean people during their fight for independence.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Liberation history, resistance culture, freedom songs
quests.culturalContext: The liberation struggle (Chimurenga) is a defining experience in Zimbabwean history. The songs, stories, and language of this struggle continue to influence Zimbabwean culture and identity.

quests.title: City Life in Harare
quests.description: Navigate modern urban life in Zimbabwe's capital.
quests.culturalFocus: Urban life, modern transportation, city culture
quests.storyNarrative: You are spending a day in Harare, Zimbabwe's capital city. You'll navigate the bustling streets, ride in a kombi (minibus), and experience how traditional Shona culture adapts to modern urban life.
learningObjectives: Learn key vocabulary related to Urban life, modern transportation, city culture
quests.culturalContext: Modern Zimbabwe balances traditional culture with contemporary life. Urban areas like Harare show how Shona culture adapts to modern challenges while maintaining its core values.

quests.title: Wisdom of the Elders
quests.description: Learn traditional Shona wisdom through proverbs and teachings
quests.culturalFocus: Traditional wisdom, moral teachings, proverbs

examples.english: I want what covers houses is thatch
The what covers houses is thatch is good
I want learning brings no shame
The learning brings no shame is good
I want kinship knows no boundaries
The kinship knows no boundaries is good

vocabulary.english: a king's child is a servant

examples.english: I want a king's child is a servant
The a king's child is a servant is good

quests.storyNarrative: You sit with the village elders as they share traditional wisdom through ancient proverbs and teachings that have guided the Shona people for generations.

quests.title: Building Good Character
quests.description: Explore Shona values and principles for living with good character
quests.culturalFocus: Shona values, ethics, character development
quests.storyNarrative: Through daily interactions and community life, you learn the values that shape good character in Shona culture: respect, honesty, harmony, and trust.
